author: ihdeveloper
title: Virtual Portal: Decentralized Place
description: Игры полагаются на централизованный сервис для создания виртуальной среды для общения и зависания. Почему бы не создать ее с помощью Cardano?

f6_assessments.q0: I think this proposal not much addresses the challenge because proposer needs to give more details about game and how it works.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal miss the plan and how it can be promoted to users.
f6_assessments.q2: No, this proposal only shows the main problem but not the surrounding.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very vague about what it intends to do and how this will impact the challenge in a meaningful way
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer states they have some experience with game development that might be relevant. Would suggest providing some additional information such as any additional references (past projects, linked in profile) and specifying which programming language experience would specifically apply to this proposal
f6_assessments.q2: Nothing was provided by the proposer that would assist in assessing the auditability of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: It is very hard to predict the success of a proposal without a way to track progress, and the information and samples provided give little confidence that the proposal will succeed.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is unclear whether the proposer has done any work of a similar scale previously.
We should have an idea as to how the idea's leverage points are superior to those offered by other community members based on the plan. It is important to be aware of why your target customers would benefit from the idea.
f6_assessments.q2:
The reason should be clearly explained in this section of your plan.
It would be helpful to have a better understanding of the proposed metrics and how they could bring value and ROI to the entire Cardano ecosystem. Additionally, the proposer has not provided any references to his past work of similar scope, nor has a detailed project plan been attached to this proposal.
In the absence of a method to track progress, this becomes an extremely vague proposal, where the information and sample documents give little confidence that the proposal is viable.
I was left with the impression that the document does address the challenge, but so much is still missing, including a roadmap, schedule, SWOT analysis, business plan, and project plan.

f6_assessments.q0: this proposal is an idea, not an application. the problem would have to be defined more precisely. if the experience described is available, the explanation should be qualitatively better. in principle, the impact would be global, but details are lacking.
f6_assessments.q1: the likelihood of success is unclear. previous products that have been delivered would help to better understand what is meant. the experience described is very impressive and should be backed up with a linked.in profile or similar. a timeline broken down into subsections would also help understanding. also an explanation for the budget is useful.
f6_assessments.q2: a roadmap with milestones helps the community to measure the progress of the project. delivery dates should be defined. possible risks and their solutions should also be defined.

f6_assessments.q0:
I'm really not sure that this proposal is complete. There is vague references to a "virtual environment" for gamers to hang out in with no additional information about it. 

I would advise the proposer to elaborate a little as describe what exactly this environment looks like, does and how it functions. Right now we do not have much information to go off of.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given that we don't know much about the proposer, or team behind it , it is very difficult to say that this proposal will be successful without more information. 

What I would like to see is a social media profile, any relevant prior work experience, prior projects and must include a detailed roadmap with reasonable milestones and KPIs for the milestones.

I.e. Create virtual environment MVP using unity/unreal gaming engine etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is basically no roadmap, nor milestones and KPIs for this proposal. There is very little that will be auditable because of the details this proposal lacks. Bare minimum I think this proposal needs to include a roadmap with milestones and KPIs to reach for.

Currently, we just do not have enough information to go off of unfortunately.

f6_assessments.q0: More clarity defining what type of platform will deliver the solution presented. More information as to the way to tackle the challenge and how it will deliver them after funding.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent reveals experience in coding but there needs to be more transparency what language and how he/she plans to adapt it to Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no KPIs, details on the plan and how the funds are used in this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Proposer wants to use cardano blockchain to establish a virtual environment for gamers to hang out with in a decentralized manner.
But there is no plan on how to implement that idea. How is a virtual environment for gamers in a decentralized manner a virtual environment? What features does it have?"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The proposer has been coded for 7 years and I know about 15 programming languages. But there is no evidence to prove that the information is true.
In addition, an unclear product, a plan that has not been released, a team of only one person are the problems that will make the feasibility of the proposal very low."
f6_assessments.q2: There is no roadmap with milestones. There are no metrics or KPIs, nor is a description of the success of the project clearly articulated.  As no clear plan is provided regarding what the funds would be spent on, it is rather difficult to imaging auditing the progress and success. In conclusion. More specifics regarding metrics, tasks, and objectives would be helpful.

f6_assessments.q0: I love people with good ideas! The proposal clearly states the problem and offers a solution. This idea, if implemented, will have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. Unfortunately, it does not represent how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal does not specify KPIs so it is hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting and proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: It would be great if we had more information on who is behind this idea ?! Is this one man or a team of people? It is advisable to present the necessary experience, knowledge and skills needed to realize this idea. Maybe via a website, LinkedIn or Github. The proposal defines a budget but it is unrealistic in relation to the volume of work and it is not clear what exactly the money will be used for. Unfortunately, the proposal does not present a detailed implementable plan, details of actionable tasks and order of execution, nor timetable to complete the work. It would be good to list the resources and technical aspects needed for implementation, the realization of the idea itself. Each project brings with it certain risks that are good to be aware of.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposer does not cite a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement and  KPIs are also not presented. Such a proposal cannot be tracked by the community due to lack of data.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on using the Cardano blockchain to establish a virtual environment for gamers to hang out with in a decentralized manner. Because this proposal is not completed [since there is no roadmap, KPIs/metrics, and budget breakdown,...], the solution is still very abstract, not a clear impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's profile is briefly described as a coder with experience of 7 years and knowing about 15 programming languages, however, there is no proof/external link for verification. Besides, a detailed plan is not provided, therefore, there is no proof of feasibility. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: This is an incomplete proposal [since there is no roadmap, KPIs/metrics, and budget breakdown,...] where auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a great idea, will support the ecosystem and could potentially ride the growing trend of games & crypto. Unfortunately it lacks sufficient detail to assess exactly how it plans to address the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience and obviously the number of programming languages is impressive, however, at this point the plan is not sufficiently presented (e.g. roadmap, milestones, architecture, language).
f6_assessments.q2: No information is provided in the proposal to audit the progress of the proposal. While the success itself could be verifiable in theory, the proposal lacks any information regarding that.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea seems like a very interesting one, but vague in many ways. I believe there are many existing decentralized hubs that the community members use to hang out already. And many games developed on the ecosystem already bring people with similar interests together. Moreover, this proposal provides no details about how it plans to achieve this and what unique features it would include in it. Therefore, regardless of how interesting the idea might look, the lack of detailed description leaves a sense of doubt regarding its impact on the ecosystem or on the gaming community.
f6_assessments.q1: There exist no plausible evidence to make conclusive assumptions regarding the probability of the proposal being a success. The proposer however provides his experience in development and the fund requested is fairly a small amount compared to the challenge's allotment. But to even add credibility to this fact, there is a lot of detailing missing. With no team introduction, fund breakup, action plan, and even the success definition, it is quite difficult to assess the feasibility of the proposal. I recommend the proposer could re-submit in the future rounds with more research and groundwork showcased.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no viable metrics that the proposer mentions himself. But even going through the idea, the chances of the proposal meeting the challenge's requirements are very slim. This proposal would make more sense if submitted under different challenges such as "community & event" or "scale-up Cardano community hubs" or even "miscellaneous challenges". Hence I find no reason to provide more than 1 star out of 5 for the clarity and auditability of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This idea is about gamers and provides an enviroment to them in cardano, but I cannot give the 5 starts because I do not get what are they going to do on chain for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: It is said that the developer has 7 years of experience, but how can we get sure of that? I think that there is not enough information about the team and of course, where is the plan presented? Imposible to imagine if the proposal will be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no information about how the proposal will be developed neither audited. No KPIs of course... There is a huge lack of information on this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of using the Cardano blockchain creates a virtual environment that helps gamers communicate with each other. I think this is a very promising proposition. Because it provides gamers with a library of games from which they can freely choose, solidifying Cardano as the go to blockchain for gaming.
f6_assessments.q1:
Even if you are an experienced programmer, working alone will be very difficult. I haven't seen your mention of your team.
I need to know exactly what you plan to do. You don't mention it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided is too sketchy and incomplete. I want to know about what the proponent wants to build. Specifically: how it works, plans, teams, KPIs, ways to attract users,...
Asking for a budget of $1500, but not saying what it will spend the money on.
I do not appreciate this suggestion.

solution: Использование блокчейна cardano для создания децентрализованной виртуальной среды для общения геймеров.
experience: Я занимаюсь кодингом уже 7 лет и знаю около 15 языков программирования. Мое призвание - разработка бэкенд игровых систем.
